text: Dena Dietrich (December 4, 1928 â€“ November 21, 2020) is an American actress. She was born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. She is known for playing Grace Peterson in Adam's Rib, Dena Madison in Karen, Estelle Milner in Paul Sand in Friends and Lovers, Molly Gibbons in The Practice Ethel Armbrewster in The Ropers, and Pearl Newman in 13 East. Dietrich also starred in The Wild Party (1975), Disney's The North Avenue Irregulars (1979) and the Mel Brooks movie History of the World, Part I (1981). She appeared on Broadway in The Rimers of Eldritch, Here's Where I Belong, and The Prisoner of Second Avenue. Dietrich was the voice of the grandmother narrator on the dark ride attraction Horizons at Epcot in Walt Disney World from 1983 until 1999. Dietrich died of natural causes on November 21, 2020, at a health-care facility in Los Angeles. She was 91 years old.Dena Dietrich, Actress Who Played Mother Nature in Margarine Commercials, Dies at 91 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1928 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American television actors Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:Actors from Pittsburgh Category:American voice actors
title: Dena Dietrich
